Colorado was approved to provide P-EBT benefits for eligible families. Families with students that were eligible for free or reduced-price meals during the 19-20 school year (or were newly eligible within the months of March, April or May) could receive up to $279 per eligible child! These monies are intended to supplement the amount of meals the student would have received should their school had been in session during school closures due to COVID-19. Families that are eligible for, and receive P-EBT, can use their benefits in conjunction with other nutrition assistance programs as well as continue to access grab-n-go meals. For more information please visit the Colorado Department of Human Services (CDHS) P-EBT webpage or the CDE School Meal Eligibility webpage.

https://www.colorado.gov/pacific/cdhs/p-ebt

MAY IS MENTAL HEALTH AWARENESS MONTH
Mental Health Awareness Month was designed to raise awareness about the importance of a healthy lifestyle and its preventative factors and benefits for the mind and to stop the stigma associated with mental health.

During these challenging times, we could all benefit from a mental health break. The CDC shared some ideas on how to cope with stress during COVID-19:

PAUSE. Breathe. Notice how you feel
TAKE BREAKS from COVID-19 content
MAKE TIME to sleep and exercise
REACH OUT and stay connected
SEEK HELP if overwhelmed or unsafe

Additionally, the school district has compiled a number of community resources and services available throughout the county. Check it out on our COVID 19 page at durangoschools.org. Be kind to your mind.

post_text: Durango High School is sponsoring a Fall Resource Fair for Durango 9-R families on December 14, 2019 from 11am-2pm in Durango High School's Cafeteria and Commons. The purpose of this fair is to connect families’ socio/economically needs at a one-stop-shop location. There will be a light lunch served and agencies such as: Manna, Good Food Collective, Pediatric Partners, Durango Adult Education, Housing Solutions, San Juan Public Health, Pro-bono legal services, Los Companeros, and others will be present with information to assist families. If available to the family, please bring identifying documents such as: driver's license, birth certificate, social security card, mail identifying home address, so that the agency can sign the family up for resources on the spot. There will also be hygiene kits, food bags, Goodwill vouchers, and winter wear available. If you have any questions please don't hesitate to contact: Katie Brandau: kbrandau@durangoschools.org 259-1630 X2316, or Sean Hembree: shembree@durangoschools.org 259-1630 X2267, or your school personnel who reached out to you.

post_text: “The 9-R J.I.V.E. Fair is a great opportunity for teens to learn what resources and events are available to them. This year the teens have partnered with the Durango School District 9-R to ramp up the job and internship opportunities. We are excited about the new partnership and the response has been tremendous.” - Stella Potemkin, Co-Chair of the Mayor’s Youth Advisory Commission.
shared_text:
City of Durango - City Government
April 29, 2019 at 3:42 PM ·

The City of Durango’s Mayor’s Youth Advisory Commission, in partnership with Durango School District 9-R, is proud to offer the eighth annual 9-R J.I.V.E. Fair, formerly the Youth Expo, on Monday, May 6th from 1 p.m. to 4 p.m. at the La Plata County Fairgrounds. The 9-R J.I.V.E. Fair (Jobs, Internships, and Volunteer Experiences) is an all-in-one forum that allows teenagers to satisfy Durango 9-R’s graduation requirements for work experience, to apply for jobs, and learn about volunteer opportunities.

Admission to the event is free. There are prizes available for event participants! For more information about the event, or to find out how to be an exhibitor, please visit the website at www.durangogov.org/youthexpo, or contact us at 375-5013 or by email at yep@durangogov.org.

While there is news of a school-related threat in the Denver metropolitan area, Durango 9-R is taking extra precautionary measures to ensure the safety of our students, staff, and schools. Local authorities have confirmed that there are not any direct threats in our community at this time. At the same time, we are working directly with local law enforcement to increase security and patrol around our buildings. We also encourage all students, staff, and visitors of our campus to be vigilant and to report any concerns to the school or to Safe2Tell Colorado (1-877-542-7233 or safe2tell.org.). Please visit our website at durangoschools.org for additional information around our safety and security resources and protocols.
